page.title: 08SCHOOL FARM, HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: This has particularly good land. its lowland fields are alluvial and the rest are on a south-facing slope. Stock & crops mature early & well. 50% of the land is grass, 1/3 permanent pasture, 2/3 ley. 40% is sown with Barley, \ of which is Winter Barley. 2\ hectares grow swedes & 1 3/4 hectares potatoes. Buildings & roads occupy c.1 hectare.The farm carries 30 {dairy}cows & 20 followers;61{beef calves;46 mule ewes produced{lambs}to the Suffolk tup.The farm is capital intensive, having 40 major pieces of machinery incl. 3 tractors & a milking machine. 3 full time workers farm the land. The farm's main suppliers are Farmway, West Cumberland Farmers, Fewsters & Rickerby. They sell feedstuffs & machinery. Main customers are Milk Marketing Board, Hexham Mart & local farmers.
